content:
SqlBytes Class

In this Article

Represents a mutable reference type that wraps either a stem.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes.Buffer* or a stem.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes.Stream*.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSchemaProvider("GetXsdType")]
public sealed class SqlBytes : System.Data.SqlTypes.INullable, System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable, System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • SqlBytes

Constructors

  • SqlBytes()

    Initializes a new instance of the SqlBytes class.

    public SqlBytes ();
  • SqlBytes(Byte[])

    Initializes a new instance of the SqlBytes class based on the specified byte array.

    public SqlBytes (byte[] buffer);

    Parameters

    • buffer
      Byte[]

      The array of unsigned bytes.

    Remarks

    If a null reference is passed in, the instance is set to null.

  • SqlBytes(SqlBinary)

    Initializes a new instance of the SqlBytes class based on the specified SqlBinary value.

    public SqlBytes (System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBinary value);

    Parameters

    • value
      SqlBinary

      A SqlBinary value.

    Remarks

    If a null reference is passed in, the instance is set to null.

  • SqlBytes(Stream)

    Initializes a new instance of the SqlBytes class based on the specified Stream value.

    public SqlBytes (System.IO.Stream s);

    Parameters

    • s
      Stream

      A Stream.

    Remarks

    If a null reference is passed in, the instance is set to null.

Properties

  • Buffer

    Returns a reference to the internal buffer.

    public byte[] Buffer { get; }

    Property Value

    • Byte[]

      Returns a reference to the internal buffer. For SqlBytes instances created on top of unmanaged pointers, it returns a managed copy of the internal buffer.

    Remarks

    Returns a null reference for null value SqlBytes.

    Throws an InvalidOperationException for stream-wrapped instances of SqlBytes.

  • IsNull

    Gets a Boolean value that indicates whether this SqlBytes is null.

    public bool IsNull { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the SqlBytes is null, false otherwise.

    Remarks

    The default value is false.

  • Item(Int64)

    Gets or sets the SqlBytes instance at the specified index.

    public byte this[long offset] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • offset
      Int64

      A Int64 value.

    Property Value

    • Byte

      A Byte value.

  • Length

    Gets the length of the value that is contained in the SqlBytes instance.

    public long Length { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int64

      A Int64 value representing the length of the value that is contained in the SqlBytes instance.

      Returns -1 if no buffer is available to the instance or if the value is null.

      Returns a stem.IO.Stream.Length* for a stream-wrapped instance.

    Remarks

    The default value is 0.

  • MaxLength

    Gets the maximum length of the value of the internal buffer of this SqlBytes.

    public long MaxLength { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int64

      A long representing the maximum length of the value of the internal buffer. Returns -1 for a stream-wrapped SqlBytes.

    Remarks

    The default value is 0.

  • Null

    Returns a null instance of this SqlBytes.

    public static System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes Null { get; }

    Property Value

    • SqlBytes

      Returns an instance in such a way that stem.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes.IsNull* returns true.

  • Storage

    Returns information about the storage state of this SqlBytes instance.

    public System.Data.SqlTypes.StorageState Storage { get; }

    Property Value

    • StorageState

      A StorageState enumeration.

  • Stream

    Gets or sets the data of this SqlBytes as a stream.

    public System.IO.Stream Stream { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Stream

      The stream that contains the SqlBytes data.

    Remarks

    Getting or setting the Stream property loads all the data into memory. Using it with large value data can cause an OutOfMemoryException.

  • Value

    Returns a managed copy of the value held by this SqlBytes.

    public byte[] Value { get; }

    Property Value

    • Byte[]

      The value of this SqlBytes as an array of bytes.

    Remarks

    Returns a null reference for null value SqlBytes.

Methods

  • GetXsdType(XmlSchemaSet)

    Returns the XML Schema definition language (XSD) of the specified XmlSchemaSet.

    public static System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName GetXsdType (System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSet schemaSet);

    Parameters

    • schemaSet
      XmlSchemaSet

      A XmlSchemaSet.

    Returns

    • XmlQualifiedName

      A string that indicates the XSD of the specified XmlSchemaSet.

  • Read(Int64,Byte[],Int32,Int32)

    Copies bytes from this SqlBytes instance to the passed-in buffer and returns the number of copied bytes.

    public long Read (long offset, byte[] buffer, int offsetInBuffer, int count);

    Parameters

    • offset
      Int64

      An Int64 long value offset into the value that is contained in the SqlBytes instance.

    • buffer
      Byte[]

      The byte array buffer to copy into.

    • offsetInBuffer
      Int32

      An Int32 integer offset into the buffer to start copying into.

    • count
      Int32

      An Int32 integer representing the number of bytes to copy.

    Returns

    • Int64

      An Int64 long value representing the number of copied bytes.

    Remarks

    If an attempt is made to read beyond MaxLength, an exception is thrown.

    If count specifies more bytes to be copied than are available from the offset to the end of the value, only the available bytes are copied.

    An exception is thrown if the destination buffer is a null reference.

    An exception is thrown if the destination buffer cannot receive as many characters as requested.

  • SetLength(Int64)

    Sets the length of this SqlBytes instance.

    public void SetLength (long value);

    Parameters

    • value
      Int64

      The Int64 long value representing the length.

    Remarks

    This method will trigger an internal conversion to a managed buffer for an instance built on top of an unmanaged buffer.

  • SetNull()

    Sets this SqlBytes instance to null.

    public void SetNull ();
  • ToSqlBinary()

    Constructs and returns a SqlBinary from this SqlBytes instance.

    public System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBinary ToSqlBinary ();

    Returns

    • SqlBinary

      A SqlBinary from this instance.

  • Write(Int64,Byte[],Int32,Int32)

    Copies bytes from the passed-in buffer to this SqlBytes instance.

    public void Write (long offset, byte[] buffer, int offsetInBuffer, int count);

    Parameters

    • offset
      Int64

      An Int64 long value offset into the value that is contained in the SqlBytes instance.

    • buffer
      Byte[]

      The byte array buffer to copy into.

    • offsetInBuffer
      Int32

      An Int32 integer offset into the buffer to start copying into.

    • count
      Int32

      An Int32 integer representing the number of bytes to copy.

    Remarks

    If this operation writes to a position beyond Length but within MaxLength, Length is updated to reflect the new ending position.

    The value of offsetInBuffer must be less than or equal to Length. An exception is thrown otherwise. Only a value of 0 can be specified when writing to a null value instance.

    If an attempt is made to write beyond MaxLength, an exception is thrown.

    Parameters

      To be added.

  • op_Explicit(SqlBytes)

    Parameters

    • value
      SqlBytes

      To be added.

    Returns

    • SqlBinary

      To be added.

    Gets serialization information with all the data needed to reinstantiate this SqlBytes instance.

    Parameters

      The object to be populated with serialization information.

    • context
      StreamingContext

      The destination context of the serialization.

  • IXmlSerializable.GetSchema()

    This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

    System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema IXmlSerializable.GetSchema ();

    Returns

    • XmlSchema

      This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

    This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

    void IXmlSerializable.ReadXml (System.Xml.XmlReader r);

    Parameters

    • r
      XmlReader

      XmlReader

  • IXmlSerializable.WriteXml(XmlWriter)

    This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

    void IXmlSerializable.WriteXml (System.Xml.XmlWriter writer);

    Parameters
